2252.verse: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

2253.verse: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.

2254.verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.

2255.verse: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

2256.verse: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."

2257.verse: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."

2258.verse: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"

2259.verse: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "

2260.verse: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."

2261.verse: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
